sentences.en: “He gets degrees in making jam/at Liverpool and Birmingham,” went one popular ditty.
sentences.cn: （“他获得了做果酱的学位/不过是在利物浦和伯明翰”这种讽刺小调说明一切）。

sentences.en: And the ditty chosen to make this momentous journey seems more than appropriate.
sentences.cn: 这支单曲的选用使得这一重大的旅程变得更有趣.

sentences.en: He quavered forth a quaint old ditty.
sentences.cn: 他用颤抖的嗓音哼了一首稀奇古怪的古老小调.

sentences.en: John poured the ditty water down the pipe.
sentences.cn: 约翰把脏水倒进了排水道.

sentences.en: Mr. Wang Yubao is a well - known Tianjin Ditty singer.
sentences.cn: 王毓宝先生是著名的天津时调表演艺术家.

sentences.en: No ditty floated into Blackmoor Vale from the outer world but Tess's mother caught up its notation in a week.
sentences.cn: 只要有小调从外面的世界传入黑荒原谷，苔丝的母亲就能在一星期里学会它的曲子。

sentences.en: Regardless, the little ditty conveyed foundational information in a happy little package.
sentences.cn: 不管怎样，这首小调在欢快的节奏下传递了基本的信息。

sentences.en: Sanqu earned by sweating, also ditty success.
sentences.cn: 所作散曲淋漓酣畅, 小曲也有成就.

sentences.en: The beggar sits on the side of the road singing ditty for money.
sentences.cn: 那个乞丐坐在路边唱着小曲讨钱.

sentences.en: The Chinese rice wine's brewing includes ditty fermentation and da qu fermentation.
sentences.cn: 黄酒的酿造可分为小曲发酵和大曲发酵.

sentences.en: Used to tune folk songs, ditty, singing mainly in small places.
sentences.cn: 所用曲调以民歌 、 小曲 、 地方小唱腔为主.

trans.tran_en: A ditty is a short or light-hearted song or poem
